com.esri.mo2.util
Class EventMulticaster

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.util.EventMulticaster
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProjectEventMulticaster
public abstract class EventMulticaster
extends Object

Provides support for managing EventListeners using the techniques described in the JavaWorld article Java Tip 79: Interact with garbage collector to avoid memory leaks, which provide a way to prevent memory leakages when the owners of EventListeners wish to be garbage-collected, but are prevented by a Multicaster, because it holds strong references to the listener, and hence to the owner of that listener.

You don't need to remove any Listeners from this multicaster because they are stored here using WeakReferences and so become available for gc'ing automatically, therefore there is no removeListener method.

public EventMulticaster()
Method Detail

isAsynchronous

public boolean isAsynchronous()
Determines if this Multicaster transmits events synchronously.

Returns:
true == asynchronous, false == synchronous

setAsynchronous

public void setAsynchronous(boolean asynch)
Sets this Multicaster to transmit events synchronously or asynchronously.

Parameters:
asynch - true == asynchronous, false == synchronous

add

public void add(EventListener listener)
Adds a Listener to this multicaster.

Parameters:
listener - event listener

getListeners

public EventListener[] getListeners()
Obtains the Listeners that are currently added to this EventMulticaster

Returns:
an array of EventListeners

fireEvent

public void fireEvent(EventObject event)
This method should be used as the primary way to fire an event. For each listener that is currently active, it invokes the method fireListenerEvent which must be implemented by subclasses

Parameters:
event - event object

fireListenerEvent

protected abstract void fireListenerEvent(EventListener listener,
                                          EventObject event)
Called by fireEvent() when an active listener has been found. There is no need to synchronize implementations of this method, since it is only invoked from within fireEvent() which is already synchronized

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be signalled
event - the event to be sent
